one_reviews_text: Ever wanted to be in a boxing match now you can. This game is amazing, you can train with doug and fight some other boxers like a octopus.

review_title: A throwback to Punch out in a VR
one_reviews_text:
I appreciate the fact that this game eases you into VR  by presenting gameplay that you know and loved in the Punch-out games  which very resently had a Wii version that was awesome.  Like Mike tysons Punch out,  you can often be unsure what to do to break your opponents pattern.  It can be fun and frustrating especially when there are seldom any tips out there in the internet.

There is definetly a lot of trail and error in this game,  that not to say you won't benefit from a workout,  I was surprisingly sore in the middle of my back, feeling muscle I didn't even know I had.  You realize not to treat the game as if it has any sort of artificial intellegence,  swingl freely and the game will just block you no matter what. You can only land punches when the game allowes you to.  Its an 8bit game in a 2020 world.   

You can pretend to be as Immersive as you want, by throwing hooks, and uppercuts,  asside from the reactions the opponents gives you,  it does nothing to the amount of damage given,  it's all the same.  Knowing when to block or bob-weave is the tricky part,  but one thing for sure tilting back will do nothing but register as a hit anyway,  so avoid the back ach!

If I had to replay this match the one I would specifically avoid is the Iron Maiden,  it was like a chore/ boring quick time event, not too fun. other then that when your tired of playing and you just want to finish the game I suggest you straight jabs, and stop being all fancy,  save that for a realistic vr boxing game.
I found this game off of youtube and I play it I love it but its hard work these people are like monsters up to 3rd person there I will try record this for youtube
i try dodging no i try blocking no nothing works

There's a lot good about Knockout League, but the basic design of the game makes it hard to enjoy.  

Basically, most of the game depends on quickly reading your opponent's animations.  By default, you don't get to act.  Rather, your opponent acts and you either 1) read their action correctly, then block/dodge and counterattack (e.g. do fun stuff) or 2) read their action incorrectly, try to block/dodge but get beat up anyhow, and not get to fight back (e.g. not do anything fun).  

Since everything centers around reading the opponent, most of the challenge comes from opponents getting increasingly tricky and hard to read.  This results in a lot of time spent misreading and getting punished, until you figure out the opponent.  Then, once you've figured them out, you can beat them fairly quickly and move on to the next opponent for more punishment.

There is a sort of challenge in all of this that's somewhat engaging, but the ratio of fun to frustation wasn't high enough for me.

one_reviews_text: to all the people that gave it a bad review.  u guys just dont understand the game. its so cool!! the training mini games are so good. this game is very wellmade. ignore those 1 star reviews. this game is top notch.

After owning a Rift for over a year and the Rift S the past few months, Knockout League is the one VR game that I play daily.  When I first bought the game, the characters were so fun to fight, but after finishing the game, I've been using it as a daily workout.  The Alley game has taken 4 inches off my waste!  Who needs to spend $39 per month on a Peloton bike when you can get a better workout with Knockout League.  Good work Grab Games!

This game is an absolute blast to play, and it's amazing how much of a workout you get from one short match.  If the devs are reading this I would love to know if there are any plans to release it for the Quest?

I tried Knockout League at my friend's house and we stayed up all night trying to beat the game.  Woke up in the morning and felt like I was in a gnarly boot camp...I was so sorry!  Happy to say I finally beat the game.  That magician character was tough, but it was so rewarding to complete this game.  Probably the VR game I've spent the most time with.

I really enjoyed the gameplay and polish in this game. If you are looking for a simulation boxing experience, try thrill of the fight, but if you are looking for a super fun game with great characters, then definitely get KO League.  There is also a minigame like fruitninja in here that could be a standalone game!

Okay so this was one of the first games I picked up for VR when I first got my Rift almost a year ago.  I thought boxing inVR was a no brainer.  At the time I was disappointed.  The opponents do not behave like boxers, they automatically block anything you throw at them unless you do a special combo, and they have attacks that can't be blocked or dodged, you have to look for an indicator and throw a punch at the right time.  It's like playing a mini game in God of War but punching instead of doing button combos.
I have gone back to many of my original games and learned to appreciate them, this is not one of them.
After experiencing other active games, and boxing games I can say I have gone from disappointed to shocked, confused, and even a little annoyed.
In a world where we now have Thrill of the Fight, and Creed, this game is not only unnecessary, but at a price around $30 it is pure robbery.  
I can highly recommend almost any other boxing game over this one at that price. After spending a morning replaying it with my current VR experience, I'd value this around $6.99 tops.

It was extremely frustrating but the developers contacted me immediately and they helped me solve this problem.

review_feedback: Another user let us know that the way he fixed this problem was by doing the following: "if your game is not launching from Oculus home, launch the game once directly from the install folder, then it should work."  Hopefully that helps, this might have been caused by some sort of update to the Oculus Home software.

one_reviews_text:
when octo punch dose the attack where he slams his tentacles down if you move out of the way it says your out of bounds and ethier get hit or dont and miss the time to attack can you  tell me how to fix this or fix it?

thanks great game :)
review_feedback:
Hi! Glad you are enjoying the game. To dodge that attack, you actually don't need to move very much as long as you lean to the correct side (he actually only slams on one side of the ring). There's a specific tell where he wiggles his hands, and that's the side you want to lean towards. Here's a video one of our players made with a full guide to Octopunch (this is the hard mode version but it is still helpful for normal mode): https://youtu.be/uDUMvjoFgWo

Hope that helps!

review_title: Could have been great, hope for KOL-2
one_reviews_text:
Pros: Polished VR experience with perfectly fitting visuals, good soundwork, and lots of content, modes, and features.  Also an intense workout.

Cons: Terrible punching implementation, lack of leaderboards for the (good) training modes

First let me say KO League is a decent VR game if you go into it knowing what to expect and like active VR games that can give a workout.  If so, I'd recommend picking it up on sale.  It has great overall presentation and lots of content, but it could have been so much better if not for some poor design decisions.  

The main offender is punching, which as you might imagine, is a huge deal in a "boxing" game.  Punching in the main campaign is absolutely terrible.  The only correct way to punch in KOL is to throw ridiculous rabbit-like short jabs as fast as possible when your opponent is stunned, because the stun lasts exactly the same amount of time regardless.  They have a "punch strength" mechanic that doesn't work (4-inch fast rabbit punches do the exact same damage as a giant hook or uppercut), along with a "momentum/golden gloves" mechanic that is supposed to reward punch variety, but fails to do so, since it also rewards pure # of punches.  The end result is boring gameplay where you basically do a reaction test/mini-game to dodge an attack/combo, and then wiggle your hands for a few seconds, and repeat.

What is really baffling is that the game engine can clearly recognize 10 different punches, but the devs didn't make any good use of this in the campaign except only 1 opponent (Iron Maiden) where it actually matters where you punch.  All opponents should semi-block when stunned like Iron Maiden, and momentum should only be gained by punch variety.

The training modes are a bit better, but the best modes have no leaderboards.  All told I was dissapointed this fell so far short of its potential and hope they make much-improved KOL-2 one day.  Something like Creed but with the fun, over-the-top opponents and attacks of KOL-1.
review_feedback: Thanks for letting us know how you solved the Oculus Home launch issue!

I feel like I have to  update my review on this game. It is SO underrated, especially with the reflex, mitts, and heavybag workouts. WOOOOOOOW! These workout simulations are by far the most realistic in VR. Even better than in the real world because there is more to work with, different colors to perceive, etc... SO good for increasing the interhemispheric communicative flow! 

Thank you so much for making this wonderful game. Looking forward to more future updates. :)
review_feedback: Hi! Once you complete the three tutorial drills for Focus Mitts, you'll unlock the Focus Mitts main menu.  From there, you'll be able to select modes such as "Quickplay."  When you select one of these modes, you'll see a button that says "mods" on the top-right side of the menu.  Click that, and a panel will slide open which will allow you to check a box next to a "Southpaw" option.  You can turn this on for any mode except for the "Drills"- these tutorials were created in a way that is unfortunately incompatible with mods.  Hope that helps!

one_reviews_text: This game is so much fun, and an awesome workout. I do about 20 minutes of training then 1-2 fights and I'm both exhausted and happy. I really forget I'm exercising. I'm just playing a game, learning a skill, having fun... and then trying to catch my breath.

The game is reletivly good as a whole , but the reason I'm writing this is because of Showtime he's the most unfair and rage inducing boss. He insults you constantly throughout the fight which alone makes me want to choke the life out of him, but I CAN'T EVEN GET PAST THE FIRST PHASE. When I take down about half of his health he starts doing uppercuts THAT I CANNOT DODGE NOMATTER WHERE THE I AM ON THE SCREEN. The game is good besides this condesending blood sucking monster.
review_feedback:
Hi!  We're really sorry about the frustration with Showtime.  One tip is to try mixing in some blocking for the attacks that you're finding difficult to dodge.  Depending on his timing, some of his attacks are easier to block, and others are easier to dodge.  Additionally, here is a great strategy video from one of our community members if you're finding yourself really stuck: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1S0n7STew6w

Hope that helps!

My only complaints: I thought the pirate was a little bland, and I wish there were a few more fighters (there are 9 here), but it's a purchase I won't hesitate to recommend. Great fun.

Game is kind of pricey (could just be me) but what a workout i was sweating like a pig after tutorial + training and first match lol, this game has plenty going for it but would like to see more things in it because it seems a little bit slim in what you can do don’t get me wrong the game is great but would love to see things such as
•	weight lifting (dumbbells ,bench press),

•	sparing sessions
•	Different leagues to work up to (rookie, intermediate ect)
•	Combination training seems a bit difficult such as 1 left 2 right 3 left 4 right gets confusing after 4 combos to remember and repeat (could just be me)
•	Punching feel like I have to reach out further then I should (once again could be me)

 But in conclusion do recommend this game it has potential and it runs/ plays well, keep up the good work devs and look forward to new content and updates

review_title: Fun boxing GAME not a simulator
one_reviews_text: THEY ADDED a timed mode to reflex alley and now the game is amazing.

Great game, it's really hard not to end up sweating after 2 or 3 fights. The graphics work perfectly, just like the sound. A pity that is not in Spanish. And I only see as a defect that he does not recognize certain blows well. It seems to give him air and the opponent is there. Buy very interesting with the discount.

regards
When I get to crimson fang it is not registering me punching her. All other opponents I had no issue with and I cannot get past her becaue it is not registering my punches at all when i fight her.
This game is so great. The tutorial takes a bit of time, but once you get through that; it is worth the gameplay!!

I've been playing this for a while now, and it's one of very few VR experiences I keep coming back to. Definitely one of my favourites! I'm not a physical or violent person at all, so a more realistic boxing simulator would be completely unappealing to me, but I gave this a try just because it was VR, and was impressed to find that it's more about pattern recognition and reaction time so it's possible to master each unique challenge with practice.

And practice has made a huge amount of difference! A couple of weeks ago, I couldn't beat Barrage at all, despite several attempts. Not just because I didn't really know what I was doing, but because I felt like I was literally going to die of exhaustion, I was so covered in sweat and out of breath! Now, after making it to Sir Octopunch in the grudge matches, I can come back to normal Barrage and beat her without being hit or breaking a sweat. Each opponent took me several attempts to finally defeat, but it felt just right, and the victories felt so much more satisfying because of it.

My only minor disappointment is that we don't get to fight our trainer as some super-difficult final challenge! Instead, I just got basically a "CONGLATURATION!" screen, which was a bit disappointing after the weeks it'd taken to get there (especially considering the impressive cutscenes introducing each fighter). There was a lot of fun in the journey, though, and I appreciate the grudge matches as a new thing to work through.
cant even get out of tutorial says blocking to soon and i dont even move whatrs up with that
review_feedback: Hi!  Sorry about the frustration.  There is a timing component to blocking properly.  When your gloves turn pink, it means that you've held your block too long, and your gloves will get disabled if you get hit.  This is a weak block.  However, if you time your block (when your gloves are still blue), you'll be able to block and return a punch of your own (this is a strong block).  This is what Doug wants you to do in the section of the tutorial that you are stuck on.  Holding your hands up without moving them won't work, because you aren't timing a strong block.

review_title: High Quality Arcade VR Boxing Experience
one_reviews_text:
High production values from the ground up, made for VR. Love it. Tutorial was well made and to the point, there are nice cinematic intros for every fighter, as well as a nice fight progression in terms of difficulty. Graphics are smooth and above average, with the ability to scale graphics to your video card. 

Most importantly, the gameplay is tactical and fun, and gives you a good workout. Please note that the boxing experience is very "arcade-like" - this is not a 1:1 boxing simulation nor does it pretend to be. You will be boxing against androids, crazy leopard-people, robots, mad scientists...and that is only the beginning.
I found this game very frustating and inconsistance.

This experience is like implementing the classic Super Punch Out inside VR! Of course people can see that there is an octopus with a mustache who is a boxer along with many other strange yet fun characters to play against, the game itself is fun. Mechanics such as "blocking" punches, "dodging" punches, punching at the exact moment right before the enemy executes his/her own punch, all of that is implemented very well. 

However, I still give it 4 stars and not 5 for a few reasons actually. Many people have also complained a little bit about some "punches" to the enemy does not register when the enemy is vulnerable. Perhaps the punches from the user is happening too quickly for the game to register it as a new punch and thus simulates the punch going "through" the enemy without any impact. Although this is only a small feature, this can take away a portion of the immersiveness to users - as it did mine. 

Another reason I strongly feel like it's lacking is the ability to punch at any given time. Me, as the user, am only playing as a counter striker and can only apply a hit if the enemy punches first or makes a move. I do not have the freedom to punch at a random time. If so, the CPU AI is going to block it 100% of the time, even on level 1. Among all the punch out games, Little Mac or whoever the player is has the ability to throw a jab at level 1 and the AI does not block it. This is not the case. Even from level 1, the player has to wait until the enemy throws the first punch so the player can counter appropriately.

Overall, its a GREAT game with amazing utilization of visual spatial representation and scaling is a strong factor. As a developer myself (and future VR developer), it's an awesome game and I can't wait to see the updates in the future :) Good luck!

review_title: Good game with some huge flaws
one_reviews_text:
The presentation is awesome but theres two things that really kill my desire to play this 

- Out of bounds
You can't move your feet to dodge otherwise the game pretty much stops and tells you "hey, you moved"  which can make some fights like the 2nd one a real pain where it feels like you have to physically dodge out of the way of some attacks but if you do the game yells at you. the only good thing about it is you can cheese it to pause the game if you need water or something mid-fight.


-Offence and Damage
Let me tell you a story, I was fighting Captain Scurvy using only straights, the time ran up and I lost. I went to training and learned the game had a combo system. I went back to fight him with my new combos I learned and I still lost. Frustrated, I fought him again but this time I just did a slapfight/waggle motion whenever I could screaming "THIS IS OPTIMAL".....I won. That was the moment that made me realize no matter what you do you can't beat the sheer amount of hits that waggling gives you.


I really wish this game had a star punch or you could charge up your punch for damage or something. Instead they opted to go for "in the zone" (which is basically, don't get hit for more damage) but that doesn't fix my core problem of you can just waggle and win because the sheer amount of hits can't be beat by trying to mix up your punches
Brilliant, just like living in Pouch Out :)

Love it! I can tell it's designed for VR from ground up. Get me super sweaty every time I play it, lot of fun! The development team are definitly professional and work hard on this game. I will suggest it to all my friends who are looking for an awesome VR sport game. BTW, the menu selection can be more intuitive during the period of training or fighting, such as user have to hold button B while they click the trigger key to select an item. Overall it's a great game.

review_title: One of the best VR games out there
one_reviews_text: Simple, fun, not buggy with a user experience that is well thought out.

To the negative reviews that say something like "Nothing similar to a REAL boxing simultation" Well, what was your first clue?  There is literally an effing OCTOPUS with a mustache and boxing gloves on the title image.  If that existed in real boxing, I may agree.  But aside from any negative reviews, this game is pretty awesome, it requires you to actually move a lot, and to throw real punches or it simply won't work. The Reflex training focus mode will make you sweat, no doubt. I'd strongly recommend this game, even for the price, well worth it.

review_title: Definitely as good as it looks.
one_reviews_text:
If you're like me and you're looking at this game, thinking it looks good and trying to decide if you want to buy it... get it.
I love a game that makes a good "Arcade" addition to my library, something I can pick up and rack up points with great graphics.  This is every bit what I hoped for.
It's definitely like Punch Out in VR.  Very polished and very fun.  Extra attention is spent on textures (which you may not see in youtube videos.)  It is a moderately intense workout for a game, and it keeps track of your calorie usage.  And in addition it has a very positive, encouraging attitude without being cartoonish in the least.  Very good game!

Unfortunately, this is more like one big quick-time event than actual boxing. You aren't allowed to attack unless your enemy misses a punch. Even if your opponent reaches back for a punch and you hit them when they're vulnerable your punch will go right through them. Most of yourr blocks do absolutely nothing, and the only way to know if they're going to work or not is just by trial and error. Some attacks can be blocked but mot cannot. It's just a very cheap game overall. And the game is way too hard for something that's completely unfair. I'm not sure why a developer would make something so cheap. The game is actually very well made, but the gameplay is beyond cheap and frustrating.

Wow, this really came a long way since the beginning of early access. The mechanics work great, and it has the same fun-factor as Punch-Out for me.  The training modes provide a lot of replayability and are fun to boot. The only issue I found is that some hits to the face/body don't register when the opponent has his/her guard down. It's a little offputting, but I move past this by memorizing when the vulnerable spots are open, and time my hits accordingly. Anywhow, this is a great addition to VR.

T-T Ah finaly. I managed to get a better score then the top dog! He still managed to cut a fair few more sec of his time then me tho. I may try to destroy that later. I will however now move on to beat the high score on the 2nd enemy. Really great workout. The score normally is not something I pay mind to, but for this. Oh boy is it a motivator. 

  Its a bit sad that to get better score the calorie counter seem to get lower... You kinda give up on playing it as a boxing game to be more effective. Still, despite the calorie thingy showing a lower number, the sweat that is raining from me would argue that its still a really effective workout. 

 I do think it could make it more clear its not really a boxing... simulator I guess. For a real boxing match game you need to look some other place.

 Oh oh oh! And today It had a free update, no dlc stuffs! :D And I have to say I do very much like the changes. More caracters and everything. I think theres like 9? I am just about to work on the 2nd enemy tho. XD Thanks to the devs for what I expect to be a lot of hours of workout.

review_title: last patch broke it for me
one_reviews_text:
hangs up on loading screen, can hear the music but screen is locked up. Only game i have that does this.  pretty fun when i could play it.

 Changed to four stars, the latest oculus update fixed it
How long is the early access? I been waiting 20mins it is still practicing??
If you have ever played punch out on the WII, then this game is a great pick. I loved punch out, and I love this game. Honestly, an essential pick for VR.

Youngster that never played Punch Out might find the gameplay lame. Anyone who played it on the other hand will likely admit it's probably as close as you can get to step into your old SNES game from back in the days, and that's something! I don't actually bother with the game itself much, but I find Reflex Alley to be my favorite VR workout, as it's way more intense than other VR sport games I own. Just take it easy on your first try especially if you're not in great shape...

I didn't put one star because i don't like the game but because when I go to download the game it says in the notifications please check your connection or try again and I bought the game a month ago and I do not know how to fix it and I am only 12 so if any one can help please help me
Great gameplay, great visuals, super fun! Love the variety of boxers!

If you've played the Punch-Out series you know what to expect from the game mechanics, however if you've played the Wii version you probably wished it had better graphics and more immersion. You get just that from this game! Great graphics, very good mechanics (it takes a while to pinpoint the perfect moment for the parry), also the sounds are great. You're going to sweat a lot with this game but it is plain fun! I think it is also a good game to showcase to friends. Just make sure they can't reach people or furnitures when they play. Can't wait for more updates! the mini games are also fun. go for it, you won't be disappointed

I Love the concept.
But it feels way to much QTE since your punch only count with specific animation moments. It would feel great to be a more "live" fights...
This is a fun boxing game that doubles as a great workout. However, if you're looking for an authentic boxing experience, this isn't for you.

I dont mean to be rude, but i dont think the one star reviewers knew what they were getting into when they bought this. This game is amazingly fun, and is a very good work out. Personally, just after my first fight i was honestly out of breath, and I absolutely loved it. This is an amazing game and well worth your time. 
Edit: To those who complain that this game isn't realistic... the screen shots show a pirate, a crazy tribal girl with a tiger mask, and an octopus with boxing gloves. If you're going into this expecting realistic, it's not the game's fault.

review_title: Kicked my butt, but it's still fun!
one_reviews_text:
So, ok. I got my butt kicked in the first bout. But the real fun so far strangely is in the training minigames... keep adding to that and I'll look into getting replacement eye-pads for my Oculus. Because I sure am more out of shape than I thought!

Oh, and as Clubber Lang would say... I pity the foo who thinks this is a real boxing trainer... no... it's just a punch-out style game for fun!

Reminds me of SuperPunchOut for Super Nintendo.  Played couple of rounds and sweated like hell, better have a towel and water near by, pretty intense.  Took me a sec to get the timing right, but once you get it, its very satisfying.
Love this game. Best I have played so far on the rift. Going to get fit in no time playing this every day. Hope the updates keep coming quick and fast!!

I wrote a review before the training part of the game was released. Game was good then, its much better now. I actually dont bother with the game and just use the training. Its great to work up a sweat and have some fun. Cant wait until they make a real boxing simulator.

review_title: Perfect balance of gameplay and exercise
one_reviews_text: I really didnt know what to expect with this game but it has gone straight to my favorite after playing it for the first time. The replay valiue on this game is great. Sure you'll get a workout, but what I love is that it keeps me engaged. Its nto a sim so have fun becuase thats what its all about.

If you are expecting a boxing sim, this isn't it.  It's an arcade boxing game like Punchout for SNES.  With that said, this game is going to give you a nice workout with the ducking and dodging.  It's really fun.  The graphics are great, as is the voice acting.  If you want an arcady style workout game, I highly recommend.  Worth the price.

I had some fun with this game but I figured out that, atleast for me, it's more like a more interactive sequence of quick time events. You have to respond to each one as the game intends you to so it lacks that much creativity. Yes you can react in more than one way, on some attacks, but it still just doesn't feel like I'm fighting in a boxing ring...

This is similar to Nintendo's Punch-Out, except you're in the ring and not a green wire-frame person. There are only four opponents that I can see, but it is fun and it is strenuous. If you want a workout, give it a whirl. Try not to have a heart attack.
Amazing game!
If you enjoyed Super Punch Out, you'll love this. The game is lively, so expect to build up a bit of a sweat playing it! One of my top favourite games in VR. Recommended.

review_title: Thrill of fight is better for me.
one_reviews_text:
"Thrill of fight"(steam game) is better for me.
Just one reason, you can not move as you want. To dodge enemy punchs, you have to move your head correct direction regularly. It's like when enemy try to deliver Hook to you. You have to move your head down. When Uppercut you have to dodge to Left or right.
And sometimes I hit by enemy even I moved my head to right way. 
This is really stressful.
So if you want move as you want. You have to buy Thrill of fight. Not this one. 
I just want deliver some Hook to developers.

review_title: 5 stars for an early access game?
one_reviews_text: This game is awesome, but the pad work is where it's at, the the accuracy is spot on, the trainer only gives you half credit for half shots... that really kicks your a--  when you are tired. The actual fight accuracy needs work, and if it can match the accuracy of the pads, it'll be a winner. Also the dodging needs work, there's no real way to know how to get out of the way. It's fun nonetheless... extreme fun if you like to move around and box. The people that are giving this anything less than 3 stars are either not paying attention to the early release caption, or more out of shape than I am. I hope these guys can finish this up.
I do boxing with my uncle and he is a REAL pro at boxing and we would both know this is nothing like real boxing.

If you see a comment by "Neuoc" About this game being horrible, disregard please he knows nothing. You cannot expect "Fight Night" out of a game like this. This game is more A Kin to super punch out, and they stay very true to this style of gameplay, Every fighter has a tactic and you can't just flail your arms wildly and expect to beat them. (In a real fight would you flail your arms at your opponent and hope to beat them?) Each character is very memorable and i love the physics the punches go where you want them to and if it wasn't for lack of haptic feedback you'd be really convinced you are ACTUALLY hitting them. The gratification alone from beating the hardest character in the game is worth it alone. And it's one hell of a workout! HIGHLY RECCOMEND!
This game is great for burning some calories. The fights are all the same. Only four different fighters. You can also do training. My husband loves that part.

i love it! great work out.
only con is that my hmd gets stweaty, is there any good cover?
Really enjoy the training side of this game.  It makes you work up a sweat in 3 mins and is a great substitute for getting to the gym for some cardio.  Main game is kinda simplistic but still fun.
Good workout, but the fight mecanics are really, really flawed.  This is not at all what I was hoping for.  The blocking/counter attack stuff is pretty weak.

review_title: first game i want a refund honestly
one_reviews_text: i wanted to like this game honestly because i love the thrill of the fight on steam...but this game is just not a boxing game at all...you can't punch anytime you want you can ONLY punch when the game allows it so pretty much is a timing game...i do'nt care for the graphics its good...but it is not a boxing game honestly

I really like this game but there is a massive problem with it and that is i seem completely unable to go on the offensive?!?!
 It seems i have to block in order to throw my opponant off gaurd so i can land a single punch or wait for them to wind up a haymaker so i can land another single punch. The only time i can go on the offensive is when my opponant is stunned and then it seems a very limited flurry!

 I really like this game and prefer its arcade style graphics and sound to the serious boxing game on Steam VR but at the moment it seems like one of those old arcade fighting games, it's impossible to land a punch... even when you clearly see your punch actually land. If it isn't your alloted moment to hit the opponant your wasting your time. My last fight i didn't even throw punches until it was "my correct time to do so", it was boring and sucked the fun out of the game.
 Whats the point of a boxing game when you can only react, i want to go on the offensive please!
 I would much rather this game than "The Thrill of the Fight" on Steam VR.
If they fix i will ammend my rating to 5*
Please don't make me use Steam VR ;)

I was skeptical about purchasing this since there are a number of low reviews. I'm glad I went ahead and purchased it, tons of fun! Let me address the complaints people have. (1) One person says the game is boring because you just step left and hit, left and hit over and over. That's inaccurate. Yes, you always have to dodge punches, no you can't just step left every time. You have to dodge left, right, lean back, block, and duck... not sure what else you are supposed to do to dodge punches in a boxing game or in a real life boxing match?? (2) Many people have complained that you can't punch whenever you want. Actually, you can, but your punch will be blocked. No, you can't swing your fists whenever you want and expect to land the punches and THATS A GOOD THING. Have you ever played a fighting game, like Mortal Kombat, with a kid? Notice how the kid will just spam punches and kicks and how annoying it is that spamming punches and kicks can often work? Well having a boxing game that allows you to punch freely would quickly devolve into the user flailing their fists around wildely with no technique and no rhythm. This game forces you to get into a rhythm and not flail your arms around like a child. I like it and I'm a bit worried about how Rec Room plans to handle boxing when they add that update, it could be really chaotic and cheap if you can throw your hands around like a crazy person and win the fight. (3) One legitimate complaint is content. Not much of it right now. Hope they update it soon.

Very immersive, a good exercice. Combats are realistic enough. Be careful not to punch the walls. The CPU is too predictable. Not enough CPU characters. Not enough replay value. Very good workout. You will sweat. You will be challenged.
great graphics, great gameplay, great fun! Game has an great sense of humor. Runs very smooth and is even good for the daily workout.

I dont understand how anyone can trash this game. It was designed to play like Mike Tysons Punch Out and it sells it well.  Has become one of my favorite Oculus titles. The only quirk i have is that running the graphics settings on max puts some sort of a line down the center of my headset. It annoying enough to where i have to run it on medium. Im using a 4ghz I7 with a gtx 1080 and everything runs smoothly on max settings with the exception of this distracting line, so i assume the problem is not in my hardware. Keep up the stellar work fellas! Also to anyone who left a 1 star review of this game, your reviews are officialy worthless to me. Do everyone one here a favor and throw your oculus out and toss yourself in front of a moving automobile.

review_title: Best boxing VR experience so far
one_reviews_text: Even though this is still early access, the game feels quite mature overall. The boxing feels good and natural. I also box in real and despite the fact that this game is an arcade style game, it feels more authentic that I thought it would. I cannot confirm the problem concerning the sensors-not-registering-the-movement. Actually, the movements of your character are quite responsive to your own movements. I am looking forward to the training modes still under development which are indicated in the game and hope that they are apt for some serious box training, including training of combos and such, which would be really nice.

review_title: It is what you think it is
one_reviews_text:
Just excellent. If you want to box against arcadey nostalgic boxing opponents well this is it. I've only done two matches (assuming there's 4 now) while I'm hoping it expands, it is just great. I did a little reading and these are the guys making the John Wick VR so I've got high expectations for the finished product of this game. 


The controls are simple but timing is critical. Aiming matters too, and the game seems really concerned with keeping you in your starting space, which is smaller than the guardian. I wandered out and the game went dark until I returned. I hope that saves my monitors when it comes down to it.  

Great game, I can't wait for more.

runs good and makes a lot of fun
There should be a different how hard or fast you hit. Lot of fun when you know how.

Although this game might have a couple glithes that Im sure can be fixed through update bug fixes, I found the game to be very entertaining, This game will definitely give you a cardio workout if you play for 20 minutes straight and more.. so be prepared to SWEAT!!!!.. Sound quality is great, the characters look awesome, and the crowd cheers you on with every blow... I'm not complaining on this one, I LOVE IT!!! I'm definitely looking forward to new content on this great game....

review_title: This Game Is Awesome! Worth The Buy!
one_reviews_text: I bought this not knowing what to expect. I was looking for an awesome boxing game. I read the reviews and almost didn't purchase it. Though, I am happy I went through with it! The game is early acess, so there are a lot more features to come! With that said as of now if you're looking for a game that will give you a workout, teach you how to block, punch and duck then this is your game! Highly Recommend!

First off, any one who rates this low because they were expecting a boxing simulator, is an idiot. One of the main screen shots shown is you fighting against an octopus....

The game plays just like a Punch-Out style boxing game.  You learn you opponents attacks, and figure out when you are supposed to strike.  

The game can be challenging, but fair. Finding out how to beat someone is very rewarding, and you need some precise blocking and dodging to do so, even on the second opponent.  

With only 4 opponents, the game should be $10 easy.  I wouldnt mind a price change as the game received more content.  

Great buy, work up a sweat, so use VR covers if you have them.

This game is already awesome in his current state. Punch-Out meets Ready 2 Rumble Boxing.

The tracking is on point. The character (at this time 4) are well designed and have different move sets. My friends and I already have a lot of fun.

It´s also a nice workout, after 2-3 fights I am sweating like I runned a marathon :)

Running super smooth on i5-4690K and AMD R390x.

Keep up the good work!

This game is, without a doubt, the most demanding as far as exercise goes. 
It’s received some bad reviews, and that was the reason I held off buying it for some time.

I decided to buy it because one reviewer said that this game provides a high level of cardio. 

Despite some of those bad reviews, considering that for some people, the game doesn’t launch, that would be more a technical issue, rather than the content. 
I was also worried about the HITS, it seems to me that making virtual reality boxing would struggle with being spot on when punching. this games does just that, it feels good to punch the opponents.

This game reminds me of Punch Out! back on the NES, its very fun, with a good deal of difficulty. 
I’m very excited, since it is still in development, polishing this game and generating more content would absolutely make this game on of the “Must have” titles.

I was looking for a nice arcade style boxing game, some fun and some much needed exercise for me. Although I have only fought one fight, I can see this is exactly what I was looking for. Runs smooth, easy to get into it, nice little 3 round fight that was a blast. I don’t usually have this big a grin on my face when I exercise. This is exactly what I wanted.
Well, it's not perfect, all negative comments are true but definitely worth to try, great new experience.

I was pleasantly surprised by the high quality models and animations. It's great with the opponent in your face and the dizzying (in a good way) effects when getting hit. I actually like that the game is a set of moves with tells you need to  memorize. Even by the second opponent you need to be able to learn the tells and the timing very well to win. It's not as freeform as some may want, I found that I simply needed to memorize the right time to block and right time to swing, I haven't had to do any complicated dodging, but I haven't fought all of the available figher's yet. Recommended.

Characters and animation are fantasic. Sound of your trainer could use some work, but in general it sounds good. One major complaint is that it's pretty unforgiving. You have to learn what the designer wants you to do to avoid a punch rather than just avoid them. Sometimes it's counter intuitive.

Very pretty, great artistic direction, runs great, but the gameplay doesn't amount to much more than glorified quick time events. I didn't expect realistic boxing, but still expected better use of VR than that. Very disappointing overall.

Hit detection is spot on. It's a great workout if you play the game like you mean it. 

Love the style of the characters. The fighting is amazing and every character I have fought has been an enjoyable experience.
(((To the Devs)))
The character skin shaders are great while actually fighting, but the training section needs a little TLC when compared...not much though... reflection captures are hitting the roughness a bit hot (Skylight or Post) and underlighting the shader. Also his lip synch timing is offset a bit with the audio...usual early access stuff that needs polish...super small and minor.  I'm pumped this game is already in the state that it is in.  You guys have done an amazing job.  Highly, Highly Recommend!!!

Terrible boxing game.  The oppoent will stick his hands high in the air, you hit him in the stomach and you get knocked out.  Complete crap in terms of real boxing.  Its basically bop-it VR boxing.  Hit the opponent the way it wants you to and you win.  Try and actually just box and hit the opponent like real and you lose.

does require a little more space to play, turn boundries off on occulus. but overall it is a fun game, really enjoyed it. great graphics, not easy to beat right away, touch controllers worked fine (I do have 3 Sensors) out right entertaining

Forces you to a spot to even start game.  Does not let you set "center" of your place space.  Forces me to the outter boudaries of my play space while my entire usable space is unusable.

>>>Update<<< you can alter the space a bit by resetting your game orientation in the oculus home menu while in game.  This will give you a bit of adjustment.  I barely fit in the play space required and i have about 6' x 4' space.

There is an issue with the light filter on the right lens.  When in a fight, if you close your left eye, you'll see the right lens will have the light filter 3/4 of the way across the panel, while the left lens will have the entire panel covered by the filter.  What you get is a noticeable line straight down the screen on the right side.

Game it self plays ok, but honestly, I feel I don't have control of my touch controllers half the time due to mechanics.  Block timing can disable your punches which makes this game feel more like DDR than an actual boxing game.  It's polished though.

I REALLY wanted to like this game & i'm sure i will when it works. 
I have a much higher than recommended spec PC so i know that's not the problem.
I know this is an early access game but after more than 10 crashes in a row without even being able to complete a single fight, i just can't give it a higher score.
Once this game actually works (IF EVER), i will be able to give it a much higher score.
I look forward to that day.
you do always the same without variations. step left, hit! step left, hit! step left hit ... after 10 minutes its getting boring. i waiting for some updates.

review_title: Mike Tyson Punch-Out in VR, Awesome!
one_reviews_text: Looking for an arcade style Boxing game that will make sweat and have fun at the same time? Well, this is it! Highly recommended guys, but make sure you have enough space area to play, other than that is a great little game to add to your VR Library.

Looks already great recommended an it will get the player in a workout nice. but in time your player should have an entry to the ring or you can choose to have an entry like the characters do. the fight can be better when you block a hook your shoot directly have a counterstrike now the characters animation gose on to long. when you calibrate the game take have a step forward so you have a bit more space fighting.

I have now played 5 matches, as well as the tutorial. Initially, the graphics were "meh" but then I turned them up to high. I'm not sure why they were turned onto low settings initially. Everything is great, I can imagine where they are going to polish the game off but it works well. Tutorial is slightly annoying but funny bc you can punch your trainer while he's talking. I got through the first boxer on the first match, but 4 matches later on the second character and I have yet too beat it. She gets more fierce as you get her angry. Looking forward to the progress this game makes and possible multiplayer modes, hopefully? Recommended.

My sensors don't seem to have any issues in other games, but here I can't even get past the tutorial. I stood there attempting to block punches by throwing up my gloves and 80% of the time the gloves don't even give me the blue aura.
I feel bad for anyone who wanders into my VR space without first getting my attention im throwing heat at these animated characters on another note i think i may have done my knee in.
Man this is fun and i am out of shape. Maybe i am putting to much into this. NOT!
Very cool game, runs smooth and is a great workout!
excellent game, excellent graphics, a real workout.  I love games like this and it is challenging for me,   this is a perfect game.
very colourful and good graphics,keeps you fit.but always places you at the back of your playspace so can see items in real world flying
One of the most fun VR games to come out since the initial wave of touch launch content.

review_title: I'm going to twitch this everyday
one_reviews_text: This game is amazing!  I'm going to get fit playing this !!  #lifegoals
Requires more room than advertised, can not play (unable to stand where the game requires)
